sub_title: Bestuursadviseur Vermogensbeheer at Pensioenfonds Medewerkers Apotheken | Member VITP
summary:
Analytical, (commercially) creative, entrepreneurial, result driven, team player, enthusiasm to take on new things and dedicated; ‘A versatile professional with international experience, strong deal making capabilities, professional risk & investment management expertise, demonstrated ability to build from scratch and a broad skill set'.

Broad and strategic thinker with an eye for the bigger picture, offering fresh perspective. In combination with analytical proficiency, this leads to good (written) communication skills and ability to make complex (investment) topics accessible to people that are less familiar with the subject matter. Trusted advisor that operates at the intersection of governing (strategic policy & advice) and hands-on implementation oversight (‘snijvlak besturen en operationaliseren – ‘countervailing power’ over de uitbestedingspartner’). Integrator that establishes strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, and actively encourages external collaboration (outside-in and inside-out).

Proficient on the buy side of financial markets (asset owners). Understanding of what drives their investment behavior as well as what moves the supply side and ability to connect the two. 

Negotiation and business partnering skills gained through current job, when (co-)managing strategic acquisitions for ING and when working as a lawyer. Open and direct way of working. Can establish good (professional) relationships quickly, even when dealing with initial restraint.

Demonstrated ability to build from scratch. Very goal oriented and work with others to deliver results, also under difficult circumstances. I take decisions confidently and get things done (‘doener’).

company.name: Pensioenfederatie (Federation of the Dutch Pension Funds)

profile_positions.description: Member of the ‘Commissie Risicomanagement’, 2011 - Present, and member of the ‘Commissie Vermogensbeheer’, 2011 – 2014 of the Federation of the Dutch Pension Funds.
profile_positions.title: Member of the ‘Commissie Risicomanagement’

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Shell Pensioenfonds (SSPF) is a ‘soft closed’ occupational defined benefit pension fund with assets in excess of EUR 30 billion. Shell Nederland Pensioenfonds Stichting (SNPS) is an occupational defined contribution pension fund that also offers the option to remain invested (‘doorbeleggen’) after retirement (‘Wet verbeterde premieregeling’, variable annuity).
A newly created role, following the events that constituted the Global Financial Crisis. Pivotal position in the investment organisation, ensuring that the Boards of the Shell pension funds in the Netherlands exert proper countervailing power on, and are in control of, investment management and related risk. Subject matter expert and trusted advisor. Requires collaboration across boundaries and ability to influence without formal authority, both internally and externally. Leading role, jointly with the SPN actuary, in Asset Liability Management studies. Strategic investment and policy advice, and hands-on in implementation, including approval of new investments. Secretary to the investment committee. Positive results (all hypotheses rejected, few findings with risk score 1 or 2, low/middle risk) and appreciative feedback from DNB, following their on-site examination (‘beleggingsonderzoek’) of SSPF, late 2016.
Quarterly risk review and dashboard, including view on non-financial risks, and support setting the broader strategic agenda of the Boards.
profile_positions.title: Risk & Investment Officer

profile_positions.description: Management of several strategic projects with the aim of meeting (prospective) clients’ need for integrated solutions. These projects included the development and marketing of a platform (‘Mijn pensioen’) for executing defined contribution pension plans (along with Life Cycle investment concepts), with an advisory role in the acquisition of Fundix (an on-line fund supermarket), deal manager (cross-divisional) of the acquisition of AZL and subsequently co-lead of the workstream ‘fiduciary management’, and co-deal manager of the acquisition of Altis (multi-manager boutique).
profile_positions.title: Director (Senior Manager) Institutional Business Development / Integrated Pension Solutions

profile_positions.description: As a commercial gatekeeper of ING's Luxembourg domiciled funds (more than 250 funds with assets under management exceeding EUR 20 billion), my responsibilities were to support the distribution of ING funds across Europe through both affiliated and non-affiliated channels (retail, family offices, multi-manager, fund of funds, insurance companies, and institutional investors), co-ordinate the marketing, operational and legal aspects, and structure and launch new funds, services and products to meet both affiliated and non-affiliated investor and distributor needs, working closely with sales, marketing, legal and fund services providers (S&P, Morningstar). Member of the Executive Committee of ING IM Belgium (CBFA approved) and member of the Board of Directors of several ING Luxembourg SICAVs (CSSF approved). I have initiated and led two major restructurings of the ING / BBL fund offerings, effectively creating a single range of ING funds, eliminating overlapping funds and transforming funds to arrive at an ‘all weather’ portfolio of funds.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director, Head of Retail Financial Services

profile_positions.description: General management responsibility for ING IM Luxembourg, active in fund management, fund administration and (marketing) support. In a challenging environment (dot-com bubble, 9/11 crisis response), my responsibilities were to manage an operation with a staff of around 25 people from various countries, a pre-tax profit contribution of more than EUR 10 million, over 67 funds under administration with net asset value totalling EUR 4 billion, of which EUR 2 billion of assets under management, and to expand the range of funds and the countries where these were registered for sale. Member of the Board of Directors of several ING Luxembourg SICAVs (CSSF approved). From November 2000 onwards, I prepared and led the successful integration of the fund administration activity and the custody business with Crédit Européen Luxembourg.
profile_positions.title: General Manager

profile_positions.description: ICI marked the beginning of institutional sales in Europe (outside the Netherlands) with main emphasis on the Nordic region. My responsibilities included liaising with institutional prospects (‘cold calling’, visits, social events and investment seminars, presentations, RfIs / RfPs, investment proposals and, in the final stage of a pitch, introduction of the investment manager), managing relations with newly acquired clients and supporting local ING IM sales units in Europe, The Americas and Asia Pacific.
profile_positions.title: Director (Senior Manager) Institutional Clients International

profile_positions.description: Start-up of a local greenfield mutual fund operation in Mumbai, India and assessment of starting up in Moscow, Russia. Implementation of the ING IM views (‘one house view’ approach) in the investment portfolio of Nationale-Nederlanden Spain, taking into account local (compliance) restrictions and tax optimisation aspects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Portfolio Manager Region Europe & Emerging Markets

profile_positions.description: My responsibilities included legal support, documentation and negotiation of structured deals on the (private) equity and fixed income credit side such as acquisition – and project finance facilities, acting on behalf of Nationale-Nederlanden as a (member of a consortium of) provider(s) of debt or equity.
profile_positions.title: In-house lawyer

profile_positions.description:
General legal practices with focus on fiscal -, contract -, (economic) penal - and insolvency law (experienced administrator / liquidator, appointed by the court).

Other activities during this period included member of the board of ‘Stichting Sport in Business’ (management and support of professional cyclists and other athletes), member and treasurer of the 1991 ‘Jonge Balie Congrescommissie’, and consulting hours for clients of the ‘Bureau voor Rechtshulp’ (Legal Aid).
profile_positions.title: Lawyer and tax counsel
